channel.title: Command.com failing
channel.description:
Ok well cmd wont open. Well it will, but it closes so fast as soon as i open it, i cannot even see the error message, something like: "command.com is not recognized as a command or something"
This is really annoying as i am trying to port forward and i need to get cmd prompt open.
I can get cmd open fine but it has c:\Documents and Settings\Dave> But i need it to just say c:
I type c: and it doesnt do anything. I type e: and it takes me to e:.
When i type ipconfig on c:\Documents and Settings\Dave> it says it is not recognized.
I searched this problem on google and found a few topics but they were never answered.
Anyone any ideas? or perhaps you can just tell me an easier way to port forward, rather then having to go through all this trouble. THanks.

item.title: Command.com failing
item.dc:creator: @LegendaryLoser .Flair
item.description:
@LegendaryLoser wrote:

He beat me =(

Also, you can use cd.. to go back in your files.

Like

C:\Program Files\Adobe
cd…
C:\Program Files
cd…
C:\

etc…

Read full topic

item.title: Command.com failing
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:7, topic:121372”]o nvm i worked it out, i had to type c:\windows\system32\ipconfig /all

Thanks alot for helping therealjdb[/quote]
Yeah anytime buddy xD

Read full topic

item.title: Command.com failing
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

o nvm i worked it out, i had to type c:\windows\system32\ipconfig /all

Thanks alot for helping therealjdb

Read full topic

item.title: Command.com failing
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

EDIT:Okay, heres the deal you need to check you path setting under environment variables and make sure it says %systemroot%\system32 somewhere in there, and if it doesn’t add it using a semicolon(;). If this doesn’t work go into start>run>cmd and type ‘path’ without quotes and post what it says. You can also try going to cmd and typing ‘cd’ without the quotes then ‘CD WINDOWS’ [without quotes] and then ‘CD system32’ [without quotes], then try typing ipconfig again.

Read full topic

item.title: Command.com failing
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

wtf it has gone to c:
but it still says ipconfig is not recognized

Read full topic

item.title: Command.com failing
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

try a batch file with ipconfig.

ipconfig /all pause

Read full topic

yeah thats what i usually do.
That failed so i try run\cmd and it just brought me to c:\Documents and Settings\Dave> which is what i dont want because ipconfig doesnt work with that.
